TITLE: Israel police arrest 2 teens in attack on Christian cemetery
SUMMARY: The graves of Christian figures at the Protestant Cemetery on Jerusalem’s venerated Mount Zion were found pushed over and pulled from their foundations on Sunday

TITLE: Putin calls on Kyiv to observe 36-hour cease-fire in Ukraine for Russian Orthodox Christmas
SUMMARY: Ukraine, which indicated it wouldn’t support such a move, has long viewed suggestions of a truce as favoring Moscow

TITLE: Old Nazi map sparks treasure hunt in the Netherlands
SUMMARY: Dutch National Archive said the map was believed to indicate four hidden boxes filled with diamonds, rubies, gold, silver and all sorts of jewelry

TITLE: Rapper who became the voice of the Iranian revolt is in danger of execution
SUMMARY: Fears for Toomaj Salehi's safety have also grown after Salehi’s official Twitter account posted that despite being in danger of losing his eyesight, he was being repeatedly beaten

TITLE: China reopens borders in final farewell to zero-Covid policy
SUMMARY: After three years and months of protest, China unsealed land and sea crossings and ended a requirement for travelers to quarantine on arrival

TITLE: Palestinian foreign minister says Israel revoked travel permits over U.N. move
SUMMARY: Riad Malki said he was returning from Brazil when he was informed that Israel had rescinded a travel permit for top Palestinian officials

TITLE: German police detain Iranian suspected of chemical attack plot
SUMMARY: “The suspect is suspected of having prepared a serious act of violence endangering the state,” authorities in western Germany said Sunday

TITLE: Naomi Osaka withdraws from Australian Open after series of health setbacks
SUMMARY: Osaka, a former Australian Open winner, did not offer a statement about her withdrawal. She has had a number of injury-related issues

TITLE: China’s Covid wave threatens another snarl of U.S. medical supply chain
SUMMARY: U.S. efforts to lessen the health care system's reliance on China will be tested in the coming weeks and months as the coronavirus rolls through China

TITLE: Russia opens espionage case against U.S. citizen
SUMMARY: The country's Federal Security Service did not name the individual or say whether they had been taken into custody

TITLE: France hit by nationwide strike as unions fight Macron’s plan to raise retirement age
SUMMARY: Demonstrations gathered thousands of people in major cities as strikes were severely disrupting transport, schools and other public services across the country

TITLE: At least 4 U.S. residents among those killed in Nepal plane crash
SUMMARY: Yeti Airlines Flight 691 crashed Sunday just minutes before landing, in a tragedy that left no survivors

TITLE: Top Israeli legal official tells Netanyahu to fire key ally after Supreme Court ruling
SUMMARY: Israel’s top court ruled that Aryeh Deri, a longtime Netanyahu ally who leads the government’s third-largest party, cannot serve as a minister because of a conviction for tax offenses

TITLE: Wintry weather leaves 78 dead in Afghanistan, Taliban says
SUMMARY: Shafiullah Rahimi, a Taliban spokesperson for the Ministry of Natural Disaster Management, said the deaths occurred since Jan. 10

TITLE: U.S. and Germany head for showdown over tanks for Ukraine
SUMMARY: “The question of tanks for Ukraine must be closed as soon as possible,” said Andriy Yermak, head of the Ukrainian presidential administration

TITLE: Brazil's president says intelligence services failed ahead of Brasilia pro-Bolsonaro riots
SUMMARY: In a TV interview, Lula said "my intelligence did not exist...We have Army intelligence, Air Force intelligence, ABIN (Brazil’s Intelligence Agency); none of them warned me

TITLE: Ana Walshe's mother says she 'cannot believe' disturbing Google searches allegedly made by her son-in-law
SUMMARY: Milanka Ljubicic's interview with NBC News comes a day after prosecutors alleged Brian Walshe dismembered and discarded her daughter's body

TITLE: In Peru, protesters pour from remote Andean regions, demand president resign
SUMMARY: “We’re at a breaking point between dictatorship and democracy,” said Pedro Mamani, a student at the National University of San Marcos who participated in the protests

TITLE: Swedish brothers handed lengthy sentences in Russia spying case
SUMMARY: Peyman Kia was sentenced to life, while his younger brother, Payam Kia, was sentenced to nine years and 10 months

TITLE: In Mexico, 15 grade school students are treated for internet drug 'challenge'
SUMMARY: They apparently took part in a challenge in which groups of students take tranquilizers to see who can stay awake the longest; authorities had issued a national alert about the craze

TITLE: 'Live fast, die young': An endangered marsupial may be mating itself to death
SUMMARY: The male northern quoll can walk more than 6 miles in a single night in the search of a mate, leading to exhaustion that can prove fatal, according to a new study

TITLE: Iranian dancing couple jailed, activists say
SUMMARY: A young couple who posted a video of themselves dancing romantically in the streets of Tehran have been sentenced to several years in prison, according to human rights activists and Iranian authorities

TITLE: Countries in the Americas should reinforce abortion protections, rights commission urges
SUMMARY: El Salvador “stood out,” the Inter-American Commission on Human Rights said, for 30- and 50-year sentences for homicide even though activists said women suffered miscarriages

TITLE: Ozzy Osbourne cancels 2023 tour dates, says spinal injury means his 'touring days have ended'
SUMMARY: The 74-year-old Grammy winner and former vocalist for the metal band Black Sabbath said that “my singing voice is fine” but that he remained physically weak

TITLE: U.S. opens embassy in Solomon Islands in bid to counter China
SUMMARY: Beijing’s bold moves in the Pacific have sent Washington scrambling to increase engagement, including by opening an embassy in the Solomon Islands for the first time since 1993

TITLE: U.S. expands military presence in the Philippines as China looms in region
SUMMARY: The agreement gives American forces access to four more bases in “strategic areas of the country,” a U.S. treaty ally facing territorial disputes with Beijing in the South China Sea

TITLE: North Korea warns of ‘overwhelming nuclear force’ to counter U.S.
SUMMARY: The comments came in response to the U.S.'s plans to deploy more fighter jets and aircraft carriers to the Korean Peninsula as it expands joint military drills with the South

TITLE: Toronto mayor steps down after affair with ex-staffer
SUMMARY: John Tory, 68, has been known as a straight-laced, buttoned-down moderate conservative — almost the polar opposite of previous Toronto Mayor Rob Ford

TITLE: East Germany’s last Communist premier dies aged 95
SUMMARY: Hans Modrow announced the first and only free election in what was known as the German Democratic Republic (GDR) in March 1990

TITLE: Despite earlier reports, soccer star Christian Atsu remains missing after Turkey earthquake
SUMMARY: Reports of him having been rescued may be premature. The Ghanaian winger starred for Chelsea, Newcastle United and several other teams in England before moving to Turkey

TITLE: Death toll from earthquakes in Turkey and Syria passes 20,000
SUMMARY: The death toll from the earthquakes that rocked Turkey and Syria has surpassed 20,000. Rescue efforts are still underway to find survivors in the destruction. NBC News’ Gabe Gutierrez has more details on the crisis with reporting from Matt Bradley

TITLE: Nicaragua frees 222 political prisoners, sends them to the U.S.
SUMMARY: Some 222 inmates considered by many to be political prisoners of the government of Nicaraguan President Daniel Ortega flew to Washington on Thursday

TITLE: Russia steps up attacks in Ukraine with broad bombardments
SUMMARY: Russian forces unleashed a barrage of missile and drone strikes against targets in eastern and southern Ukraine early Friday

TITLE: Russia launches new offensive in Eastern Ukraine
SUMMARY: Russian troops have launched a new offensive across Eastern Ukraine and are battering the town of Chasiv Yar with artillery day and night. NBC News’ Richard Engel is there speaking to families who have lost so much in the ongoing conflict

TITLE: 2 killed and 5 wounded in Jerusalem car-ramming
SUMMARY: Medics say six-year-old boy among those killed in the attack that came amid spiraling tensions in the contested capital

TITLE: Death toll from earthquakes in Turkey and Syria passes 23,000
SUMMARY: Authorities in Turkey and Syria say the death toll from the massive earthquakes has grown to more than 23,000 but rescuers are still finding life. NBC News’ Gabe Gutierrez has more details on the stunning stories of survival

TITLE: Iran marks anniversary of Islamic Revolution amid anti-government protests
SUMMARY: Thousands of Iranians marched through major streets and squares decorated with flags, balloons and placards with revolutionary and religious slogans

TITLE: 'No sweeter word than freedom': Biden assails Putin and vows to keep helping Ukraine
SUMMARY: Biden spoke in Poland to mark the first anniversary of the Russian invasion of Ukraine

TITLE: Putin blames West for war in Ukraine
SUMMARY: Russian President Putin called what’s happening in Ukraine a “special military operation” and branded it as a war with the West for Russia’s survival. NBC News’ Keir Simmons has more details on Putin’s State of the Nation address

TITLE: Biden makes defiant address on Ukraine ahead of Russian invasion anniversary
SUMMARY: President Biden made an address ahead of the one-year anniversary of Russia’s war in Ukraine, offering an unmistakable message to Russian President Putin that “Ukraine will never be a victory for Russia.” NBC News’ Kristen Welker has more details on how Americans are feeling about the conflict.&nbsp

TITLE: Dozens of British employers stick to 4-day workweek after pilot
SUMMARY: Trial is the largest in the world, according to British-based research organization that published the report alongside a group of academics and with backing from New Zealand-based group

TITLE: Russia's opposition is united against Putin but divided on basically everything else
SUMMARY: “Russians in exile never have been capable of forming an opposition force. There is infighting, distrust and no clear agenda,” said Andrei Soldatov, a top security expert

TITLE: British-born woman who joined ISIS aged 15 cannot regain her U.K. citizenship, court rules
SUMMARY: Shamima Begum left London in 2015 and traveled to Syria, where she married an ISIS fighter and gave birth to three children, all of whom died as infants

TITLE: Pilot thought instructor who died during flight was 'just joking,' safety report says
SUMMARY: The pilot had noticed that the flying instructor was unresponsive for some time, but thought he was "pretending," a report detailing the incident, which unfolded near Blackpool Airport in Lancashire, England, on June 29, said

TITLE: Teacher in France stabbed to death by high school student, police say
SUMMARY: French media reported that the student, born in 2007, said he heard voices telling him to kill the 53-year-old teacher of Spanish at the private Catholic school in Saint-Jean-de-Luz

TITLE: Honduras expands and extends its state of emergency
SUMMARY: The measure suspends some constitutional rights and allows security forces to detain people who they consider associated with or have committed crimes.&nbsp

TITLE: Army blocks Israeli activists supporting torched West Bank town
SUMMARY: Soldiers shoved protesters to the ground in the West Bank town of Hawara, activists said, pressing their knees into their necks and backs before briefly detaining them

TITLE: Nicaragua has committed executions, crimes against humanity, U.N. group states
SUMMARY: It names President Daniel Ortega and Vice President Rosario Murillo, his wife, as participants in the violations and calls for international legal action and sanctions against those involved

TITLE: King Charles III chooses France and Germany for first state visits
SUMMARY: The picks underscore Britain’s efforts to build bridges with its European neighbors following years of strained relations caused by Brexit

TITLE: Atomic Heart video game draws scrutiny from Ukrainian officials and gamers for alleged Russia ties
SUMMARY: Critics of the game argue that buying Atomic Heart supports Russia’s assault on Ukraine

TITLE: Hong Kong court convicts activists behind Tiananmen vigils
SUMMARY: Chow Hang-tung, Tang Ngok-kwan and Tsui Hon-kwong could be sentenced six months in jail and fined 100,000 Hong Kong dollars ($12,740

TITLE: Philippine governor and 5 others killed in gun attack
SUMMARY: “My government will not rest until we have brought the perpetrators of this dastardly and heinous crime to justice,” said president Ferdinand Marcos Jr. in a statement

TITLE: Fire at Indonesian fuel storage station kills 17
SUMMARY: The fire burned some houses and sent nearby residents in the densely populated areas into a panic, some of whom fled with their belongings, footage from broadcasters showed

TITLE: Suspected poisonings of Iranian schoolgirls
SUMMARY: Across the country today, 16 provinces reported dozens of students falling mysteriously ill, according to local media. Over the last three months, reports suggest that more than 1,000 schoolgirls have suffered from mysterious cases of respiratory distress. The government, which had previously suggested the incidents were “false,” is now investigating

TITLE: China to fully reopen borders to foreigners, but near-term hurdles remain
SUMMARY: Western democracies’ unfavorable views of China have intensified because of human rights concerns, aggressive foreign policy and Covid-19 handling, according to a global survey

TITLE: Roman aristocrat unearthed in ancient cemetery that could show Britain's shift to Anglo-Saxons
SUMMARY: Experts have hailed the 1,600-year-old cemetery that was unearthed near the city of Leeds as a “once-in-a-lifetime” find that bridges the gap between the ancient and medieval periods

TITLE: Storm Freddy kills more than 100 as it slams southern Africa
SUMMARY: Freddy is one of the strongest storms ever recorded in the southern hemisphere and could be the longest-lasting tropical cyclone, according to the World Meteorological Organization

TITLE: Lula pledges lands in first presidential visit with Indigenous in Brazil’s Amazon
SUMMARY: Lula said he wanted quick demarcation of Indigenous lands "before other people take over” but stopped short of any new designations anticipated by Indigenous rights activists

TITLE: 'Downton Abbey' castle halts weddings because of Brexit
SUMMARY: Highclere Castle in southern England, where the early 20th century period drama about the lives of aristocrats and their servants was filmed, is facing a serious staffing crunch

TITLE: Clashes erupt in Pakistan as police try to arrest Imran Khan
SUMMARY: Supporters of the former prime minister threw bricks at officers who fought back with clubs and tear gas as they besieged his house in the city of Lahore

TITLE: Honduras to seek official ties with China, deepening Taiwan’s isolation
SUMMARY: President Xiomara Castro’s announcement implies her government will sever relations with the self-ruling island, which is claimed by Beijing and has few remaining allies

TITLE: Has the mystery of Leonardo da Vinci's mother finally been solved?
SUMMARY: The Renaissance master and painter of the “Mona Lisa“ was in fact just half-Italian, according to new research revealed Tuesday, with his mother a slave from the Caucasus

TITLE: Russia warns 'hostile' U.S. aircraft away from its border after drone crash
SUMMARY: Moscow's ambassador to Washington, Anatoly Antonov, made the comments after being summoned in protest over Tuesday's incident near Ukraine
